message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MM, cs.COM. 

The paper discusses superimposed pilots as an alternative to time-multiplexed pilot and data symbols for mitigating pilot contamination in massive MIMO systems. This topic falls under the area of wireless communication and signal processing, which is covered by several sub-categories in computer science. The most likely sub-category is cs.IT (Information Theory), which deals with the fundamental limits of communication systems and channel coding. The paper proposes a non-iterative and iterative data-aided scheme for uplink channel estimation, which involves processing of signals and data, and hence, it could also belong to cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also discusses the performance of a hybrid system that utilizes both time-multiplexed and superimposed pilots, which could fall under cs.SY (Systems and Control) or cs.COM (Computers and Society) as it involves system design and optimization. Finally, the paper deals with massive MIMO systems, which is a sub-field of cs.MM (Multimedia).
